cinvestav.android.pki.db.controller
Class CRLController

java.lang.Object
  cinvestav.android.pki.db.controller.CRLController

public class CRLController
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements all the methods for accessing the Data Base layer classes, it should be the connection between the view layer an the database layer for retrieve and modify CRLs information

Since:
31/07/2012
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ing. Javier Silva PÃ©rez - [javier]

getById

public CRLDAO getById(java.lang.Integer id)
               throws DBException
Get a CRLDAO from the DB using its Id as SQL filter

Parameters:
id - CRL data base Id
Returns:
a CRLDAO object filled with the data base information if the CRL id was found, or an empty CRLDAO object (id = 0) if no results were found in the data base
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

getBySerialNumber

public CRLDAO getBySerialNumber(java.lang.Integer serialNumber)
                         throws DBException
Get a CRL list using the serial number as SQL filter

Parameters:
serialNumber - Serial Number of the CRL that will like to search
Returns:
a CRLDAO object filled with the CRL saved with the desired serial number , if no coincidences are found, an empty CRLDAO object (id = 0) will be returned
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

public java.util.List<CRLDAO> getByIssuerCertificateId(java.lang.Integer issuerCertificateId)
                                                throws DBException
Get the list of all the CRLs issued by a CA using its certificate Id as SQL filter

Parameters:
issuerCertificateId - Id of the certificate to be used as filter
Returns:
A list of CRLDAO filled with all the CRLs issued using the desired certificate, or an empty list if no CRL were found
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

                                                          throws DBException
Get the list of all the CRLs issued by a CA using its certificate Serial Number as SQL filter

Parameters:

Returns:

Throws:

getByIssuerSubjectId

public java.util.List<CRLDAO> getByIssuerSubjectId(java.lang.Integer issuerSubjectId)
                                            throws DBException
Get the list of all the CRLs issued by a CA using its subject Id as SQL filter, so this function will return all CRL issued by a CA no mater what certificate was used for sign it

Parameters:
issuerSubjectId - Id of the CA subject in the data base to be used as filter
Returns:
A list of CRLDAO filled with all the CRLs issued by an specific subject, or an empty list if no CRL were found
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution

getByAdvancedFilter

public java.util.List<CRLDAO> getByAdvancedFilter(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> filter)
                                           throws DBException
Gets a list of CRLs that were founded using the specified filter

Parameters:
filter - It's a Map which has the following structure:
  • Key = Tag of the filter to be used, should be define in DataBaseDictionary, this tags must be written as a SQL WHERE clause using PreparedStament form for example: 'DBfield = ?' or 'DBfield LIKE ?'
  • Value = Must be a string array of 2 positions where:
    • [0] = Value to be searched in the data base
    • [1] = Data type, according to this, the PreparedStatemen will be constructed, the valid DataTypes are defined in the DataBaseDictionary (e.g DataBaseDictionary.FILTER_TYPE_TABLENAME_FIELDNAME)
Returns:
A list of CRLs that agrees with the filter
Throws:
DBException - If something goes wrong during the SQL statement Execution
